thread.title: EastEnders viewers OUTRAGED at 'disgusting' Brexit-fuelled racism storyline on BBC soap
thread.title_full: EastEnders viewers OUTRAGED at 'disgusting' Brexit-fuelled racism storyline on BBC soap

title: EastEnders viewers OUTRAGED at 'disgusting' Brexit-fuelled racism storyline on BBC soap
text:
EastEnders viewers OUTRAGED at 'disgusting' Brexit-fuelled racism storyline on BBC soap EastEnders viewers OUTRAGED at 'disgusting' Brexit-fuelled racism storyline on BBC soap BBC viewers were left disgusted at a racism storyline during tonight's EastEnders which saw the Queen Vic covered in graffiti. PUBLISHED: 20:57, Tue, Feb 21, 2017 | UPDATED: 21:06, Tue, Feb 21, 2017 
During the opening scene, Konrad Topolski (played by Piotr Baumann) was seen to pick up a Polish flag as "Poles go home" was scrubbed from the front door of the Albert Square local. 
Mick Carter (Danny Dyer) jet-sprayed the red paint from the "Polish night" signs as Konrad said: "This is the Britain we live in now." 
One viewer tweeted: "#Eastenders wow not expecting this racism no match for Mick and his power wash." 
"'Poles go home' - Beyond disgusting. #EastEnders," posted another as a third wrote: "Wow. Theres a lot of racism going around. The polish are nice people. Leave them be. #EastEnders." Related articles
